title: No children node listing when changing data source for a dataset in the dataset editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a dataset in the dataset editor page of the query tab, there are no children node listings. The following steps to reproduce can be observed: 1. Create a new dataset without a SQL statement. 2. Select a new data source that does not have any database/table/column information. Actual result: The children node listing is not displayed when changing the data source for a dataset in the dataset editor page of the query tab. Close the dataset editor and reopen it.
SR: 1. Create a new dataset without a SQL statement. 2. Select a new data source that does not have any database/table/column information. 3. Verify that the children node listings are not displayed. 4. Close the dataset editor and reopen it to confirm the issue.
